title: estheblessed
author: estheblessed
content: Watching the current market and the demise of ALL crypto ... is this the end for certain coins?How do people think the likes of ETH, ADA, XRP, TRON etc will go from here?

comments.author: Jackl87
comments.body: Quote from: estheblessed on June 22, 2022, 03:43:15 PMWatching the current market and the demise of ALL crypto ... is this the end for certain coins?How do people think the likes of ETH, ADA, XRP, TRON etc will go from here?It is true that it is not easy to follow the crypto market at the moment and also your portfolio when it went down like more than 50% within the last few weeks and possibly more than 90% since the height of the last bull market back in may of 2021. Usually in a bear market the altcoins suffer way harder from falling prices then Bitcoin itself. This has been the case in all bear market if have witnessed so far and i am following the crypto space since 2017.I don't think that any of the coins that you have listed will die, they are just to big and established already in order to completely die. If all of them stay relevant and will also rise again to new ATH's when the next bear market comes, i don't know. Some of them will some of them will probably not.

comments.author: Davian144
comments.body: Quote from: estheblessed on June 22, 2022, 03:43:15 PMWatching the current market and the demise of ALL crypto ... is this the end for certain coins?I've seen a lot of downturns in the crypto market and this is not the end for any particular coin because in the past there have also been huge drops in the price of crypto coins, but things can get better and it's not the end of everything.QuoteHow do people think the likes of ETH, ADA, XRP, TRON etc will go from here?Cryptocurrency products such as ETH, ADA, XRP, and TRON are products that are very valid in the market and for certain communities so there is always demand and supply going on. You don't have to worry if you currently still have ETH, ADA, XRP, and TRON, because they will all improve again in the market.

comments.author: masulum
comments.body: All the altcoins you mention have use cases, there are many platforms created on the blockchain of some of the coins you mention, so they might be hard to be dead, and I don't agree with your title that altcoins are dead. It will be different if what you are showing is new tokens and coins that have no volume. Crashes are normal, we've seen them time and time again. The current crash, is temporary, it may be necessary to distinguish between whether to die and not being able to touch ATH anymore. If it is related to ATH, there is a possibility that altcoins are difficult to get to ATH, and I have experienced this in several altcoins such as MUE, XVG, SC and others, but they still exist despite crashing from ATH 2017 and not hitting old ATH till today.

comments.author: Samurai trieng
comments.body: indeed at this time altcoins have experienced a lot of decline and until now there have been no signs of increasing again, but in my opinion this is not the end of altcoin growth, because the current decline is not comparable to the decline in crypto in 2018, where crypto has a very deep decline at that time, after its we can see altcoins grow rapidly in the following year, I recommend for beginners to start investing with altcoins now because they are very affordable,

comments.author: Pelana vreo
comments.body: Quote from: estheblessed on June 22, 2022, 03:43:15 PMWatching the current market and the demise of ALL crypto ... is this the end for certain coins?How do people think the likes of ETH, ADA, XRP, TRON etc will go from here?The current market situation is almost the same as it was in 2017, however some new investors are afraid of losing a lot of money due to the current price drop.Looking back a bit, when BTC was $63k USD, everyone panicked to buy, but when it was $20k USD only a few investors bought it and most importantly, altcoins always followed the BTC price.

comments.author: Rengga Jati
comments.body: Quote from: estheblessed on June 22, 2022, 03:43:15 PMWatching the current market and the demise of ALL crypto ... is this the end for certain coins?Maybe  This is a bearish era where all cryptocurrencies are struggling for survival. The best will survive, and the least will be dead because of this bearish market that will be still ongoing. This is not new. many new projects or coins with low cap or volume may be easy to die and cannot survive. But, for certain coins, this becomes the era to buy more and hold them for the long term until the bullish era is coming. Why? because some of those altcoins may be able to survive, struggle, and develop even during this bearish market. They will also follow the Bitcoin rate, which is actually very dropped, those altcoins will be also dropped. But, as long as they can survive, commonly worthy altcoins are able to rise up and reach their ATH again in the future. But, for what coins? I am not sure, because none can predict it exactly. We can see from the past bearish market where Ethereum also had very dramatic drops until this can go higher and higher again due to the bullish market
